Tech.title: The year in AI and culture
Tech.description: From the advent of AI actress Tilly Norwood to major music labels making deals with AI companies, 2025 has been a watershed year for AI and culture.

Tech.title: Memory loss: As AI gobbles up chips, prices for devices may rise
Tech.description: Demand for memory chips currently exceeds supply and there's very little chance of that changing any time soon. More chips for AI means less available for other products such as computers and phones and that could drive up those prices too.

Science.title: Uncovering the mystery of how algae makes snow green, red or orange
Science.description: Snow isn't always white; algae can make it look green, red, or orange, and scientists are trying to understand how and why these colorful patches appear.

Business.title: Late shopper rush drives Boxing Day sales traffic
Business.description: Figures suggest the surge in post-Christmas shoppers was the strongest in a decade.

Culture.title: Central Casting marks 100 years of Hollywood extras
Culture.description: For 100 years, Hollywood has relied on Central Casting. It's the real company behind movie extras—and where stars like Gary Cooper, Hattie McDaniel, and Brad Pitt got their start.

Culture.title: Sophie Kinsella urged me to finish my bestseller, says Jojo Moyes
Culture.description: Moyes has credited Kinsella with inspiring her when she nearly gave up after writing 20,000 words.

Culture.title: Brigitte Bardot, sex goddess of cinema, has died

Culture.description: The cocktail of kittenish charm and continental sensuality who swept away the cinematic cobwebs of the 1950s.

Culture.title: Finding out I've got ADHD has saved my life

Culture.title: Film lookahead: 20 highlights to watch out for in 2026
